abstract: Yahoo finally looks ready to do a deal, according to BusinessWeek, which cited people familiar with the situation. Pressure from large shareholders, including Carl C. Icahn and hedge fund Paulson & Company, has persuaded Yahoo to work out a transaction with Microsoft, or alternatively, with Google, according to the magazine.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo finally looks ready to do a deal, according to BusinessWeek, which cited people familiar with the situation. Pressure from large shareholders, including Carl C. Icahn and hedge fund Paulson & Company, has persuaded Yahoo to work out a transaction with Microsoft, or alternatively, with Google, according to the magazine.

headline.main: A Deal For Yahoo May Be Nigh, Report Says

abstract: Google is touting its efforts to make browser applications more powerful at its conference for software developers in San Francisco.
snippet: Google is touting its efforts to make browser applications more powerful at its conference for software developers in San Francisco.
lead_paragraph: Google has been a leading proponent of Web-based computing — software that is delivered over the Internet and typically runs inside a browser. But most browser applications cannot do many of the things that more powerful PC-based software can.

headline.main: Google Pushes to Make Browser Applications More Powerful

abstract: Yahoo CEO Jerry Yang and President Susan Decker laid out their strategy Wednesday for running the company as an independent entity. Essentially, they want to narrow Yahoo’s focus and try to do for display advertising what Google has done for search ads.
snippet: Yahoo CEO Jerry Yang and President Susan Decker laid out their strategy Wednesday for running the company as an independent entity. Essentially, they want to narrow Yahoo’s focus and try to do for display advertising what Google has done for searc...
lead_paragraph: Should Jerry Yang be running Yahoo?

headline.main: Jerry Yang Says He’s the Best Deal in Town
